content.description: Figure 1 represents part of a process that occurs in eukaryotic cells. There are untranslated regions (<math alttext="U T R" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mtext>UTR</mtext></mrow></math>) in this sequence.
content.question: Figure 1. Cellular process involving nucleic acids Which of the following best explains the process represented by Figure 1 ?

choices.label: The synthesis of <math alttext="m R N A" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>m</mtext><mtext>RNA</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> in the <math alttext="5 prime" overflow="scroll"><mrow><msup><mrow><mn>5</mn></mrow><mrow><mo>′</mo></mrow></msup></mrow></math> to <math alttext="3 prime" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msup><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow><mrow><mo>′</mo></mrow></msup></mrow></mstyle></math> direction from <math alttext="D N A" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>DNA</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>
The modification of a protein to produce a functional form of that protein
The translation of an <math alttext="m R N A" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>mRNA</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> molecule into a polypeptide

The enzyme-regulated processing of pre‑<math alttext="m R N A" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>mRNA</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> into mature <math alttext="m R N A" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>mRNA</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>

content.answer: The enzyme-regulated processing of pre‑<math alttext="m R N A" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>mRNA</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> into mature <math alttext="m R N A" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>mRNA</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>

skill.text: 2.B: Explain relationships between characteristics of biological models in both theoretical and applied contexts.
